title: A nice interface into GitHub...
comment: It does what it says, and the UI is very clean and crisp and responsive. Keep up the good work! =:)

Best github app available. 1 small request: under releases->downloads the downloads are shown in a very small scrollable frame. If this frame could be enlarged to show all downloads and enable scrolling for the whole screen, that would be great!
Pls add contributions diagram to user profile

title: Can't search issues?
comment: Disappointing...

Nice app, but I REALLY dislike how the app's back button isn't in sync with my Nexus navbar back button in terms of functionality. Using my navbar buttons does its back function right, unlike the app's back button which will sometimes exit the app even if I'm a few pages deep.

title: No Web sign on
comment: As other reviewers have stated,  an app like this should use oAuth for secure sign in via a browser.  I'll try out the app, once that is addressed.

title: Very nice
comment: Works really well
The best Github app, hands down. Particularly well designed UI.

title: Thumbs
comment: Thanks

title: Shouldn't need my password
comment: Github supports OAuth, which means I should be able to sign in on the Github website securely rather than having to trust some random app with my password. Just saying "app doesn't store password" in the description is NOT ENOUGH.
Best github app
better than the official app!

title: Thank You

title: Awesome app
comment: Awesome app. Thanks to the developer for providing good support.
Go to github website - Settings - Personal access token, and delete Gh4a token, then relogin again.
Works well, and it's the first github browser on Android that allows me to search my code. It does it quite well.

title: Functional and looks nice
comment: Nothing to complain about. It's a no frills github client. Thanks devs!
So much better than the official app

title: Feature rich.
comment: This app has features that are conspicuously missing from the official app, such as syntax highlighting and find-in-page.

title: Great!
comment: This is a really good app! And I'm glad it is also open source so I can learn from it and possibly make my own from it. Great :)

title: Good lightweight access

title: Best
comment: Best GitHub app ever !!

title: Best GitHub client by far
comment: This beats everything else available for Android by a long shot, especially the official GitHub app. Minus one star for missing notification support.

title: Finally!
comment: I was about to give up on finding a GitHub manager for Android when I found OctoDroid. I did look at this one before, but I was looking at a bunch then and somehow missed it.  Thanks Azwan Adli.

title: Definitely more refined than the official app!
comment: It's a great alternative to the official github app, which sadly hasn't been updated for several months now. Highly recommended!

title: Man love it.
comment: The recent addition of inapp code browser is the best thing that has happened. All text on black makes it so much useful. And not to forget the file commenting that can be done now. Best app ever.

title: Very good
comment: Your app is very fast and easy to use, but I think it has a bug: my news feed shows activity from 2 weeks ago,. but nothing from the recent activity. (which is daily)  Also, the github notifications would be a great addition - that's the single most important feature in my opinion.
Notification will come in next version.  For the news feed, can you open an issue so that we can discuss further. Thanks.

title: Best
comment: Far better than github's app

title: Excellent
comment: Great UI, all functions I need. Blows official Github app out of the water.

title: Very good app for reading through repos
comment: Very good for reading through repos and looking at code, but doesn't have any modification ability, like the official app I believe does. I don't know how easy this is to implement with the Github API as I don't know the technical details, but it really would turn it from a good to a fantastic app. Also, it could benefit massively from a navigation drawer I think.

title: Best in its kind

title: Hello
comment: I have onions in my trousers.
Just great

Fatal flaw that it requires password access, needs to use oauth/revokable access.	Security is paramount, and the "use password" approach isn't a good approach.  Compromises github account integrity.  Some other minor issues that pale in comparison:  No way to favorite repositories/bad sorting of own repositories.  Thus finding your favorite repo ends up taking a lot of searching/scrolling each time.

title: Compromising you github account
comment: Should use oauth and not credentials to fetch data. As it is now it all users are compromising their github accounts.
